revision.comment: Removing from [[Category:Participants in American reality television series]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name = Hunter Ellis |birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1968|7|5}} |birth_place = [[Alexandria, Virginia]], U.S. |children = 2 |residence = [[Austin, Texas]], U.S. |alma_mater = [[University of Southern California]] |television = ''[[Survivor: Marquesas]]'' |occupation = [[Actor]]
[[Television personality]] }} '''Hunter Ellis''' (born July 5, 1968, [[Alexandria, Virginia]]) is an [[United States|American]] military veteran and television personality.{{cite web|url=http://www.history.com/content/manmomentmachine/about-the-host|title=Hunter Ellis History Channel bio|publisher=[[History (U.S. TV channel)|History Channel]]|accessdate=December 28, 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100208005611/http://www.history.com/content/manmomentmachine/about-the-host|archivedate=February 8, 2010}} A former naval aviator, he was first noted for his participation on ''[[Survivor (TV series)|Survivor]]'' before going on to host several television shows for the [[History (U.S. TV channel)|History Channel]], including ''[[Tactical to Practical]]''; ''[[Man, Moment, Machine]]''; and ''[[Digging for the Truth]]'', before hosting [[The CW Television Network|The CW]] [[reality show]] ''[[In Harm's Way (TV series)|In Harm's Way]]''. ==Background== Part of a family with a strong tradition in the [[United States Navy]], Ellis is the grandson of [[Naval Aviator]] and Vice Admiral [[Donald D. Engen]]. He graduated from the [[University of Southern California]] with a [[bachelor's degree]] in [[political science]], before entering the Navy as a commissioned officer and being designated as a Naval Aviator following completion of flight training. Ellis graduated first in his flight training class and, during his ten-year military career, he amassed 433 carrier landings and more than two thousand hours of flight time in the [[F/A-18 Hornet]].{{cn|date=May 2018}} After resigning his commission, Ellis worked for a time as a pilot for [[FedEx Corporation]].{{cite web|url=http://www.cbs.com/primetime/survivor/bio/hunter_4/bio.php|title=Hunter Ellis ''Survivor: Marquesas'' bio at CBS|publisher=[[CBS]]|accessdate=December 30, 2009}} ==Personal life== Ellis is a member of the [[Fraternities and sororities|fraternity]] [[Alpha Tau Omega]]. He currently resides in [[Austin, Texas]], with his wife and daughter.{{cn|date=May 2018}} ==Career== Ellis was a participant in the reality TV program ''[[Survivor: Marquesas]]'', which was filmed in 2001 and aired in 2002. A member of the Maraamu tribe, Ellis was the third contestant voted off the show.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2002/03/14/survivor/main503745.shtml|title=Heave-Ho For Hunky Hunter|last=Cosgrove-Mather|first=Bootie|date=March 14, 2002|publisher=[[CBS News]]|accessdate=December 30, 2009}}{{cite news|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,218117,00.html|title=Plane Awful|last=Shaw|first=Jessica|date=March 15, 2002|publisher=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=December 30, 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://www.the-top-tens.com/lists/worst-survivor-players.asp|title=Hunter Ellis profile|publisher=Top-tens.comzAutos.com|accessdate=May 14, 2018}} Subsequently, Ellis became the host of several nationally televised programs. The first of these was ''[[Tactical to Practical]]''{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117885716.html?categoryid=1614&cs=1&query=%22Hunter+Ellis%22|title=History net launching new fronts|last=Oei|first=Lily|date=May 6, 2003|publisher=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=December 30, 2009}} (also known as ''Tactical to Practical With Hunter Ellis''), which aired on [[History (U.S. TV channel)|The History Channel]] as a program that took a historical look at the development of common consumer electronic products which originated as military research projects.{{cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/sun_sentinel/access/405019761.html?dids=405019761:405019761&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Sep+13%2C+2003&author=Scott+Sandell++Los+Angeles+Times+Zap2it.com&pub=South+Florida+Sun+-+Sentinel&desc=PUTTING+MILITARY+TECHNOLOGY+TO+CIVILIAN+USE&pqatl=google|title=PUTTING MILITARY TECHNOLOGY TO CIVILIAN USE|last=Sandell|first=Scott|date=September 13, 2003|publisher=[[South Florida Sun-Sentinel]]|accessdate=December 28, 2009}} It lasted for three seasons, with 38 episodes airing in 2003-04. In 2004, he began co-hosting ''9 on the Town'', a half-hour program airing five days a week on [[KCAL-TV]] (channel 9), an [[Independent station (North America)|independent station]] in [[Los Angeles, California]]. In 2005, he began hosting another show on [[History (U.S. TV channel)|The History Channel]], called ''[[Man, Moment, Machine]]''. Episodes of this show focus on the historical consequences of the momentary interaction between a particular individual and a specific technology. In 2007, Ellis became the host of ''[[Digging for the Truth]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.history.com/content/diggingforthetruth/meet-the-new-host|title=Meet the New Host|publisher=[[History (U.S. TV channel)|History Channel]]|accessdate=December 28, 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090429205707/http://www.history.com/content/diggingforthetruth/meet-the-new-host|archivedate=April 29, 2009}}{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117965643.html?categoryid=14&cs=1&query=%22Hunter+Ellis%22|title=History to do more 'Digging'|last=Dempsey|first=John|date=May 22, 2007|publisher=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=December 30, 2009}} and in 2008 became host of ''[[In Harm's Way (TV series)|In Harm's Way]]''.{{cite web| url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117990132.html?categoryid=14&cs=1&query=Hunter+Ellis|title=Hunter Ellis to host 'In Harm's Way'|last=Levine|first=Stuart|date=August 5, 2008|publisher=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=December 29, 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://www.realitytvworld.com/news/ex-survivor-castaway-hunter-ellis-host-cw-in-harm-way-7610.php|title=Ex-'Survivor' castaway Hunter Ellis to host The CW's 'In Harm's Way'|date=August 6, 2008|publisher=Reality TV World|accessdate=December 28, 2009}} Ellis was a news anchor for [[KEYE-TV]] news in [[Austin, Texas]] from 2011 until he left in 2014 to focus full-time on documentaries.{{cite web|url=http://tvradio.blog.austin360.com/2015/01/05/morning-anchor-hunter-ellis-leaves-keye/|title=Morning anchor Hunter Ellis leaves KEYE - TV & Radio|publisher=|accessdate=23 May 2017}} ===Filmography=== *''[[Survivor (TV series)|Survivor]]'' (3 episodes, 2002) *''[[Tactical to Practical]]'' (2003) (TV) *''9 on the Town'' (2004) (TV) *''Test Drive'' (1 episode, 2005) (TV) *''[[Man, Moment, Machine]]'' (13 episodes, 2005–2007) *''Extreme Yachts'' (2006) (TV) *''[[Digging for the Truth]]'' (8 episodes, 2007) *''[[In Harm's Way (TV series)|In Harm's Way]]'' (2008) (TV) *''A Grail of Two Idiots'' (2012) (short) *''Misirlou'' (2013) ==Awards & recognition== In 2003, Ellis received an [[Emmy Award|Emmy nomination]] for hosting ''Countdown to Survivor: The Amazon'' for [[KCBS-TV]],{{cite web|url=http://www.emmys.org/awards/2004la/2004laawards.php |title=56th ANNUAL LOS ANGELES AREA EMMY AWARDS|work=Google cache|publisher=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences]]|accessdate=December 30, 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060719071114/http://www.emmys.org/awards/2004la/2004laawards.php|archivedate=July 19, 2006}} and in 2006 he received a [[Los Angeles]] [[Emmy Award]] for hosting ''Hola! Survivor: Guatemala'', also for KCBS.{{cite web|url=http://www.emmys.tv/2009/winners-58th-annual-los-angeles-area-emmy-awards-announced|title=Winners of the 58th Annual Los Angeles Area Emmy Awards Announced|date=August 12, 2006|publisher=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences]]|accessdate=December 30, 2009}} In an article published on December 1, 2003, ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine named him one of the 20 sexiest men on [[cable television]].{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20148757,00.html|title=Hunter Ellis: Fly Guy|date=December 1, 2003|publisher=[[People (magazine)|People]]|accessdate=December 28, 2009}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|1152623|Hunter Ellis}} * [http://www.cbs.com/shows/survivor/cast/20683 Hunter Ellis biography] at for ''[[Survivor: Marquesas]]'' at [[CBS]].com {{Survivor contestants}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ellis, Hunter}} [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American television personalities]] [[Category:United States Navy officers]] [[Category:United States Naval Aviators]] [[Category:University of Southern California people]] [[Category:Aviators from Virginia]] [[Category:Male actors from Alexandria, Virginia]] [[Category:American political scientists]] [[Category:Male actors from Austin, Texas]] [[Category:Survivor (U.S. TV series) contestants]]
